entry.title: Fade Into You
entry.summary:
Author: rinonrin

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,053Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 20

Summary: This wasn't part of the plan. You were supposed to leave Gotham, not save it.It's been five years since your one and only love was tragically murdered—and found by you. You've been working on making a life for yourself since then. No vigilantes, no street fighting.Until a new name on Gotham's underworld catches your attention.

entry.title: Haunted by the Thought of You
entry.summary:
Author: BoggieBoat

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,715Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: Ghosts aren't real. Every story ever told about one is just clearly made up just to get a rise out of anyone who would listen to such an idiotic tale- especially the one currently circling throughout Gotham Academy. After all, why would a murderous, vengeful spirit of a teacher possibly haunt a school for the rest of eternity and claim students' lives for something that happened generations ago? And, no, Damian Wayne is not scared- he's a trained assassin and fights crime with Batman almost every night! Why would an old urban legend possibly ruffle the Robins' feathers? Even the teacher he told the story to thought that it was ridiculous!Why he is the only person who's able to see them is irrelevant. Don't ask.

entry.title: Strangers in the Night
entry.summary:
Author: unnamedmystery

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,383Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 199

Summary: When the Daily Planet heard word of a new vigilante in Crime Alley that supposedly had no affiliation with Batman, Perry White thought it to be a nice short story—a quick in and out. After all, while the people of Metropolis had Superman, everyone knew of Batman, and a vigilante not working with him seemed interesting. At least, that’s what Perry told his college intern. And her mentor Clark Kent when he raised concerns. No one told her that the vigilante was intimidatingly attractive. Or that Crime Alley was the worse place in Gotham City. Or that her mentor would ask a friend to keep tabs on her. Or that the detective she’s staying with hates Batman despite working with him frequently. Or that the detectives neighbor was a really cute guy.

entry.title: and still, i came back (to you)
entry.summary:
Author: xyluem

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,642Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 16

Summary: You were never the type to dislike change. You didn’t complain when your family moved to Metropolis for your parents’ new jobs when you were ten. You didn’t panic when one of your drone test runs accidentally trapped Superman of all people. You didn’t even flinch when he offered you a smile, curious rather than angry, offering something that sounded suspiciously like a partnership. You adapted. You learned. You thrived. To you, becoming Superman’s sidekick was just another challenge to figure out. One moment you were tinkering in your garage; the next, you were upgrading the security systems and arguing with Justice League AI systems that didn’t understand sarcasm. You were fine with all of it.You were fine with everything. Until the day you were sent back to Gotham. Back to the city that never truly forgot you. Back to the shadows you’d unknowingly left behind—and the damage you never realized you caused. Because Gotham remembers. And the ghosts here don’t stay buried. (mostly jason todd/reader and tim drake/reader, but has slightly yj member including superboy, wonder girl, and impulse/reader)

Summary: Gotham City — but not the high-rise chaos we usually see. The story focuses on a small, older neighborhood just outside Crime Alley. They also volunteer at a local community center, helping street kids and runaways — some of whom have been directly affected by Gotham’s gang wars.

entry.title: if you tend to it
entry.summary:
Author: dreamtiming

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,441Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 41

Summary: “You should come and stay with me.” He states, his voice resolute, determined as he makes his way to his ultimate goal. Your heart turns over in your chest as you try to subtly swallow, thinking of something to say.  “Without a chaperone? In sin?” You wiggle your eyebrows as you try to restrain your smile. “People will talk, Jason.” “What do they have to talk about? People know we’re friends.” He clenches his fists again and averts his gaze to the crumpled glass, though you don’t see, too busy sweeping debris into a discreet pile. Words he means to say will remain unspoken for now, it seems.  — tl;dr: oh my god they were roommates. Jason Todd/Reader

entry.title: Red Hood, Green Heart
entry.summary:
Author: Persadol

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 109,750Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 155

Summary: Jason Todd has died before-and he hasn't quite come back whole. Haunted by shadows of his past and the weight of justice in Gotham, he finds comfort only in silence and the static crackle of Alfred's voice in his comms.That is, until the night a portal rips open above him and a very unexpected visitor-blue-skinned, horned, and definitely not from this world-crashes straight into his life. Literally.You're a druid from the forests of the Forgotten Realms, on a peaceful path of healing and harmony… until a bandit ambush and a wild spell gone wrong land you flat on top of a masked stranger in a dark, alien city.Jason doesn't do magic. You don't do guns. But somehow, between Gotham rooftops and druidic spells, trauma and trust, gunfire and green growth-you might just change each other's worlds.

entry.title: Red in between the Lines
entry.summary:
Author: kimismiki

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,420Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 13

Summary: Peter operates on his own, working endlessly through his internship at a company that doesn't even respect his art— until he earns that respect, he works day in night in the fashion world of Gotham, and makes pieces, fixes pieces, and brainstorms pieces day and night, even causing him to have to stay overnights at the studio, on a dirty couch he bought second hand. As with everyone else, Peter isn't excused from having Trauma, and suffering from the fact that he has homophobic parents that blame him endless for his brothers death, his previous "not so job", a man from his past that continues to haunts his own narrative— and then theres Jason, who he meets at the Spot, inside of Peter's favorite cafe. Awkward glances, gawking, even blood, starts to beginning of a friendship that Peter endears— he is cracking his doors, letting someone in his life, while also trying to get even a small peak through his. Red in between the Lines deals with dark, mature, & explicit themes, that go hand and hand with trauma, politics, selfishness & selflesness, and more. Updated tags about certain themes will be added as the story progresses, with any necessary triggers being added before the chapter begins.
